title: Delhi terror blast: NIA nabs Soyab for aiding Umar Un Nabi; 7th arrest so far
content: The National Investigation Agency has arrested Soyab from Faridabad. He is accused of harbouring terrorist Umar Un Nabi. Soyab also provided logistical support to Un Nabi before the car bombing. This is the seventh arrest in the case. The NIA is continuing its investigation to uncover the full conspiracy behind the attack.

title: Significant risk to Uri hydro plant: How CISF thwarted Pakistan retaliation during Op Sindoor
content: CISF personnel displayed extraordinary courage, foiling a Pakistani retaliation that put the Uri hydroelectric plant under risk and nearby residents amidst intense shelling. Their swift actions led to the safe evacuation of 250 civilians and secured critical national assets. Nineteen CISF members were honored for their bravery during this high-risk operation following India's retaliatory 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: 'We are one nation': Arunachal woman's unity post after Shanghai harassment
content: An Indian national, Pema Wang Thongdok, faced alleged harassment by Chinese authorities at Shanghai airport when her passport was deemed invalid due to her birthplace being listed as Arunachal Pradesh. She was denied boarding and basic facilities before consular intervention allowed her to depart, reigniting the border dispute debate.

title: Nvidia publicly responds to 'losing' $250 billion to 'Google deal,' declares: We are‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia, the AI chip giant, publicly defended its market dominance after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering billions in spending on Google's competing AI chips. This news sent Nvidia's stock down significantly, while Alphabet shares rose. Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a serious challenger, with Meta potentially renting them from Google Cloud.

title: Prison sentence begins: Brazil ex-president starts 27-year jail term
content: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to begin a 27-year prison sentence for plotting a coup to prevent Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva's inauguration. Bolsonaro, detained for tampering with his ankle monitor, denied escape plans, citing medication-induced paranoia. His imprisonment leaves Brazil's conservative base without a clear leader for the 2026 elections.

title: Xi trumps the Don amid fraying ties with Japan and India
content: China's leader Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump held a call solidifying their "G-2" compact with mutual visit invitations. This occurred as Beijing pressed Taiwan claims amid spats with Japan and India, with Trump's public statement omitting any mention of Taiwan, focusing instead on trade.

title: Ahead of 2026 assembly polls: Assam CM tries to revive ‚Äô83 riots ghost
content: Assam's government released the 41-year-old Tewary Commission report on the 1983 disturbances, including the Nellie massacre. The report, alongside the unofficial Mehta Commission report, diverged on the causes and perpetrators of the violence. While Tewary blamed the anti-foreigner agitation led by Aasu and AAGSP, Mehta pointed to earlier attacks by migrant Muslims.

title: Amazon's AI power play: Tech giant vetoes third-party tools; 'Kiro' takes centre stage
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to cease using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, mandating exclusive use of its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: 'Every action of ours should strengthen national goals': PM on Constitution Day
content: Prime Minister Modi urged citizens to prioritise constitutional duties for a robust democracy, emphasising voting as a key responsibility. He suggested schools honour first-time voters, linking duties to national progress. PM Modi also paid tribute to Sardar Patel and Bhagwan Birsa Munda, highlighting their contributions to India's unity and tribal empowerment.

title: Smriti Mandhana‚Äôs father discharged and stable; no update on wedding date yet
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana's father, Shrinivas, has been discharged from the hospital and is stable after experiencing chest pain, initially suspected to be a heart attack. This led to the indefinite postponement of Smriti's wedding to Palash Muchhal. Doctors confirmed Shrinivas was diagnosed with angina, not a heart attack, and an angiography revealed no blockages, easing concerns.

title: 'CM chair out of stock': BJP mocks DK Shivakumar in AI clip; leadership row grows
content: BJP's AI video mocks Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar amid speculation of a leadership change. Supporters are pushing for his elevation as the Congress government reaches its halfway mark. While CM Siddaramaiah remains confident, a group of legislators are in Delhi lobbying for Shivakumar's appointment, keeping the debate alive.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google‚Äôs AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has declared a permanent switch from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing its superior reasoning, speed, and multimedia capabilities. This endorsement signals intense competition for OpenAI, with even its CEO acknowledging rivals' advancements while emphasizing their own pursuit of superintelligence.

title: National level basketball player dies after pole collapses during practice in Haryana
content: A 16-year-old national-level basketball player, Hitesh Rathi, tragically died in Rohtak when an unstable iron basketball pole collapsed on him during practice. He was attempting to hang from the hoop when the structure buckled. The Haryana Olympic Association has suspended all state sports events for three days in his honor, and an investigation is underway.

title: MP university campus: Students torch vehicles, attack chancellor‚Äôs bungalow
content: Protests at VIT University turned violent late Tuesday after dozens of students fell ill with suspected jaundice, alleging poor hygiene and food quality. Students reportedly set vehicles ablaze and damaged property, with unconfirmed reports of student deaths. Police are investigating the illnesses and damage, while university and district authorities remain silent.

title: India‚ÄìEAEU FTA: India opens formal talks with Eurasian bloc today
content: India is set to commence Free Trade Agreement negotiations with the Eurasian Economic Union this Wednesday, aiming to boost exports, especially for MSMEs, farmers, and fishermen. This move follows recent challenges with US tariffs.

title: Canucks goalie Kevin Lankinen steps away; how his absence could impact season
content: Vancouver Canucks face a goaltending crisis on a crucial road trip as Kevin Lankinen departs for personal reasons. This leaves the team without their recent starter, compounding the absence of the injured Thatcher Demko.  AHL call-ups Jiri Patera and Nikita Tolopilo are now on standby, highlighting the team's urgent need for stability between the pipes.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note to Stephen days after marriage remark
content: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Jammie Booker wins World‚Äôs Strongest Woman title as Andrea Thompson issues protest
content: The 2025 World's Strongest Woman event sparked controversy as Jammie Booker, reportedly a biological male, secured the top prize. Runner-up Andrea Thompson's visible dismay and subsequent comments ignited a fierce debate on fairness in women's sports. Prominent athletes and fans rallied behind Thompson, questioning the integrity of the competition and advocating for clear rules.

title: Japan PM Takaichi speaks to Trump after his 45-minute phone call with Xi
content: In the wake of rising tensions surrounding Taiwan and a widening divide between China and Japan, Japan‚Äôs newly appointed Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi engaged in discussions with Donald Trump. Takaichi labeled Taiwan as an 'existential threat,' a statement that incited severe backlash from Beijing, which retaliated by imposing seafood import bans.

title: Top shares to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari identifies Swiggy and Bajaj Auto as top buys, citing bullish technical indicators like engulfing patterns and RSI divergences. Conversely, Vedanta is flagged for a 'sell' recommendation due to bearish RSI divergence and a trendline breakdown, suggesting potential downside.

title: Hidma slogans raised: FIR alleges pre-planned Delhi pollution stir; WA group under police lens
content: Delhi Police are investigating a WhatsApp group allegedly used to coordinate a violent pollution protest. The group, with over 200 members, is central to the probe, with two admins arrested. Protesters are accused of blocking a police station and raising slogans, leading to 22 arrests and injuries to four personnel.

title: Has Smriti Mandhana unfollowed Palash Muchhal on social media? Fact-check
content: Social media rumors of Smriti Mandhana unfollowing her fianc√© Palash Muchhal are incorrect, with their wedding postponed due to simultaneous family medical emergencies. Mandhana's father experienced heart-attack-like symptoms, followed by Muchhal's own health complications, leading to an indefinite delay as both families prioritise recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rallies strongly; BSE Sensex up over 650 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was near 26,100, BSE Sensex was up 650 points.

title: 'Follow your passion' is worst advice: Here's why Mark Cuban says it misleads professionals
content: Mark Cuban challenges the common advice to 'follow your passion'. He argues that consistent effort leads to skill, which then fosters enjoyment and eventually passion. Time invested in work is a better indicator of future success than abstract excitement. Professionals should focus on where their effort is directed, as this reveals true career direction and opportunity.

title: IND vs SA: Conrad's 'grovel' remark sparks outrage; Kumble calls for 'humility'
content: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad's use of the word "grovel" to describe his team's strategy against India has sparked controversy.  Former Indian cricketers Anil Kumble and Cheteshwar Pujara expressed shock, highlighting the word's offensive historical context and advising humility when on top.  Pujara suggested the remark might instead motivate the Indian team.

title: ‚ÄòI had no idea‚Äô: Zohran Mamdani on ‚Äòweirdest‚Äô moment at White House ‚Äî watch
content: New York Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani said the ‚Äúweirdest‚Äù thing he noticed at the White House was a coffee-table book titled UFC at the White House. He spoke about the moment on a podcast, his calm demeanour during the visit, and how the meeting with Donald Trump contrasted sharply with their bitter campaign exchanges.

title: Karnataka road crash: Sr IAS officer Mahantesh Bilagi among 3 dead in Kalaburagi
content: A tragic accident claimed the lives of senior IAS officer Mahantesh Bilagi and two family members in Kalaburagi. Their car veered off the road after attempting to avoid a stray dog, leading to the fatal crash. Bilagi, a 2012-batch officer and MD of Karnataka State Minerals Corporation, was en route to a family wedding.

title: Greta Thunberg banned from Venice for pouring green dye into Grand Canal in protest
content: Greta Thunberg and a group of environmental activists undertook a shocking protest in Venice, dyeing the Grand Canal bright green to raise awareness about insufficient fossil fuel regulations at a UN climate summit. However, their bold actions resulted in a two-day prohibition and fines, as many deemed their approach disrespectful to the historic UNESCO site.

title: 'Lawrence Bishnoi' jacket trend: Gangster photo sparks fashion craze in Rajasthan
content: A viral photograph of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in a distinctive jacket has sparked a new social media trend in Rajasthan, leading to the arrest of three men selling replicas. Police are cracking down on the glorification of criminals, warning that such trends normalize crime and attract impressionable youth to gang culture.

title: Germany‚Äôs giant Christmas tree lit: Built from 1,200 spruces, touted as world‚Äôs largest ‚Äî video
content: Dortmund, Germany, has officially kicked off the festive season by illuminating its colossal 45-meter Christmas tree. Constructed from 1,200 Norway spruces and adorned with 140,000 LED lights, this impressive installation has been a market centerpiece since 1996. Hundreds gathered to witness the spectacle, with residents viewing it as a cherished start to holiday celebrations.

title: ‚ÄòHe injected me with mercury‚Äô: Bengaluru woman's ‚Äòpoisonous‚Äô death puts businessman in soup
content: A young mother in Bengaluru died after accusing her husband of slowly poisoning her with mercury injections. Her pre-death statement, recorded from her hospital bed, detailed the alleged poisoning and subsequent torture. Police are now investigating the case as a dowry death, awaiting forensic reports to confirm the presence of mercury.

title: Former Man City star sparks controversy with raunchy photoshoot with Olympian girlfriend
content: Dutch athletes Jill Roord and Pien Sanders are making headlines. The football and hockey stars have revealed their relationship. Their intimate photoshoot has drawn significant attention. Both athletes ended previous long-term relationships to be together. They are prioritizing personal happiness amidst public scrutiny. Roord and Sanders continue to balance their careers and their two-hour commute.

title: 'Doing a great job': White House dismisses reports of Kash Patel‚Äôs firing
content: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt refuted a report claiming President Trump was considering firing FBI Director Kash Patel. Leavitt shared a photo of Trump and Patel together, stating the story was fabricated and Trump laughed at the headline. She asserted that Trump and his team are satisfied with Patel's performance.

title: 'DK Shivakumar will be CM soon': Congress MLA says 'he's 200% sure'
content: Karnataka Congress legislators have met with senior party leaders in New Delhi to discuss the demand for Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar's elevation as Chief Minister. The legislators stressed the need for the high command to resolve the leadership uncertainty, which they believe is detrimental to the party.

title: HDFC Bank, Blue Star & more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today
content: Jefferies initiated coverage of LG Electronics India with a buy rating, citing its strong position in discretionary spending. JP Morgan maintained an overweight rating on Reliance Industries, increasing its target price due to attractive valuations and expected earnings growth.

title: 'Jealous of her friendship with another man': B'luru man kills woman, shaves head
content: Bengaluru police arrested Prem Vardhan in Tirupati for the murder of his friend, Devisri. Traced via mobile tower data and CCTV, Prem confessed to killing Devisri after an argument fueled by jealousy. He attempted to disguise himself but was apprehended due to his mobile signal.

title: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal wedding postponed: Complete timeline of events
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding celebrations were postponed due to her father's sudden illness. Hospitalized with angina, his condition prompted Mandhana to halt the ceremony indefinitely. Her fianc√©, Palash Muchhal, was also briefly hospitalized for stress-related symptoms, adding to the family's difficult time.

title: Lakers vs Clippers injury report: Who‚Äôs out for Nov 25 showdown
content: The Los Angeles Clippers faced the Lakers on November 25, 2025, severely short-handed with key players like Bradley Beal and Derrick Jones Jr. sidelined. Despite Kawhi Leonard's return, the Clippers' 5-12 record reflected their injury struggles. The Lakers, while missing Deandre Ayton, fielded a more stable roster led by LeBron James and Luka Donƒçiƒá.

title: Top 5 of CFP unchanged; Ducks leapfrog Ole Miss
content: Ohio State, Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech remained the top five teams in the latest College Football Playoff rankings released Tuesday, while Oregon jumped ahead of Ole Miss after its win over USC.

title: Okla. State hires UNT's Morris to revive program
content: Eric Morris, who has led North Texas to a 10-1 record this season while averaging 503.3 yards per game, has been hired as the next coach at Oklahoma State.

title: Vols, amid 'chatter' over schedule, topple Houston
content: Having heard the "chatter that we hadn't played anybody," Rick Barnes' No. 17 Volunteers took down No. 3 Houston at the Players Era tournament on Tuesday and avenged their loss to the Cougars in last season's Elite Eight.

title: Suggs tossed, 4 others T'd up in Magic-Sixers tiff
content: A heated altercation toward the end of the first half in Tuesday night's Magic-Sixers game resulted in Jalen Suggs being ejected and four other players receiving technical fouls.

title: NYC mayor vows to punish brawlers at UFC 322
content: New York City mayor Eric Adams is vowing to hold fighters who were involved in a massive cageside brawl at UFC 322 at Madison Square Garden on Nov. 15 accountable pending an investigation.

title: Missing HS coach wanted on criminal charges
content: Travis L. Turner, who disappeared days before his undefeated team's playoff game, faces charges of possessing child sexual abuse material and using a computer to solicit a minor, Virginia State Police said.

title: üò≥ Is LeBron's most remarkable streak at risk?
content: James has scored in double-digits for nearly 1,300 straight games. But there is another streak that's even more remarkable -- and now in danger.

title: Bill Belichick's legacy takes a detour at North Carolina
content: A season in, the legendary NFL coach's head-scratching decision to helm a lowly ACC team continues to confound.

title: Men: Purdue stays No. 1 overall, but the top four get a shake-up
content: The headlines might not be screaming about them, but we're noticing the Blue Devils' 1-seed-worthy r√©sum√©.

title: Women: Michigan up, Duke down and UConn still No. 1 overall
content: The Blue Devils have fallen short of preseason expectations, while rising Michigan has blown past them.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: We updated our rankings ahead of Week 13 -- and picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Can the Predators turn their season around?
content: Nashville is the NHL's worst team in the standings. Is there any hope of contention -- or is it time to make trades?

title: The untold story of John Cena's rap album, 'You Can't See Me'
content: "The Doctor of Thuganomics" wasn't just a gimmick. Andreas Hale spoke to the musicians who worked with Cena on his album from 20 years ago.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Doubt looms around Survivor Series: WarGames favorites
content: The "villain" team, led by The Vision, won the advantage match at "Raw." Are they favorites to take WarGames?

title: Teen star Estevao has Chelsea looking like a team that deserves 'world champions' tag
content: After a win like this in the Champions League over Barcelona, led by teen star Estevao, maybe Chelsea are the real deal after all.

title: Man City's squad issues were made apparent in loss to Leverkusen
content: Despite a rotated lineup, Manchester City's reserves did not showcase their talents and were left exposed.

title: How good are this year's top Japanese free agents -- and who could sign them?
content: We break down what to expect from Tatsuya Imai, Munetaka Murakami and Kazuma Okamoto in 2026 and where they might land.

title: They hired who?! Making sense of MLB's newest class of managers
content: A 33-year-old, a college coach, a recently retired reliever ... it's been quite an offseason for unconventional skippers. What does it mean?

title: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. The pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: Inside Lions DE Aidan Hutchinson's contract extension, and Micah Parsons' role
content: The Lions wanted to sign Hutchinson to a long-term contract, but deals for other pass rushers, especially Micah Parsons, kept moving the target.

title: One year of Amorim: How Man United have changed for the better -- or not
content: It has been one year since Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Man United. There has been some improvement, but the core metrics of Amorim's influence tell a different story.

title: Why Bayern boss Kompany is well placed to succeed Guardiola at Man City
content: If Bayern's clash with Arsenal is an audition to replace Pep Guardiola, ex-City defender and ESPN FC analyst Nedum Onuoha thinks Kompany fits the bill.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: Haney takes over at welterweight, Mason makes debut at 135
content: Devin Haney and Abdullah Mason shined in decision victories. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Omarion Hampton's practice window is open -- just in time for the fantasy trade deadline
content: Kris Rhim provides an update on RB Omarion Hampton, and how the Chargers' backfield could look when he returns.

title: MLS Cup conference semis talking points: All roads lead to Miami, Messi
content: Inter Miami's first MLS Cup is within reach after a convincing win over FC Cincinnati. Here's what else stood out from the conference semis.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG, Real Madrid monitor Upamecano
content: Bayern Munich defender Dayot Upamecano is a target for Paris Saint-Germain and Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Heisman Trophy race: Will Jeremiyah Love run past Fernando Mendoza, Julian Sayin?
content: The top candidates have emerged in the Heisman race, but what will it take for Jeremiyah Love to vault past Fernando Mendoza and Julian Sayin?

title: Pickups: Time to add Collin Gillespie, Derik Queen, Jusuf Nurkic
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

content: Your essential guide to lineup strategy for December, including how to use the NHL schedule to your advantage.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Nepali Woman Arrested At Mumbai Airport With Fake Indian Passport
content: Police have arrested a woman of Nepali origin at Mumbai international airport for trying to travel to Oman by allegedly using a forged Indian passport, an official said.

title: India Takes A 'LEAP' Forward With Giant Maintenance Facility In Hyderabad
content: PM Modi virtually inaugurated French major Safran's maintenance, repair and overhaul facility for LEAP engines that power commercial aircraft.

title: At 8 Degrees Celsius, Delhi Records Coldest November Morning Since 2022
content: Delhi on Wednesday witnessed the coldest morning of the season with the minimum temperature dipping to 8 degrees Celsius, the lowest in November since 2022, the India Meteorological Department said.

title: NDTV Investigation: Kerala Woman Who Tried To Radicalise Son Married To Terror Convict
content: An NDTV investigation has unearthed disturbing details in the alleged ISIS indoctrination of a 16-year-old boy from Kerala by his mother and others.

title: On Camera, Teen Basketball Player Dies In Freak Court Accident In Rohtak
content: A 16-year-old national-level basketball player died in a freak accident in Haryana's Rohtak after the basketball pole fell on his chest during practice. Hardik was practising in the court in Lakhan Majra when the pole, apparently not planted firmly,

title: PM's Appeal To Strengthen Constitution, Rahul Gandhi's Pledge To Shield It
content: Leaders cutting across party lines pledged to protect the Constitution and uphold its values as the country celebrated Constitution Day today. November 26 is celebrated every year to mark the adoption of the Constitution in 1949.

title: Cyclone Senyar Brewing Over Indian Ocean: How The Storm Got Its Name
content: A developing weather system over the Indian Ocean is showing signs of strengthening into a cyclonic storm, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Once in effect, it will be called Cyclone Senyar.

title: Faridabad Man Arrested For Helping Delhi Suicide Bomber, 7th Suspect In Custody
content: A Faridabad resident has been arrested for helping the suicide bomber behind the deadly blast near the Red Fort on November 10.

title: Toddler On Roof, SUV Drives For 10 Km After Hitting Bike In Madhya Pradesh
content: A one-and-a-half-year-old boy was driven for nearly 10 km on the roof of a speeding Scorpio after it rammed into a motorbike carrying the child and his family.

title: Couple Found Dead At Home, Lipstick Messages On Walls Point To Murder-Suicide
content: A spine-chilling incident rocked the Atal Awas Colony in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Monday, where a husband and wife were found dead under mysterious circumstances.

title: 'Americans First': Team Trump Hikes Fees For Foreign Tourists To Famous US Parks
content: Starting in 2026, visitors from abroad will have to pay $100 on top of the individual park fee to enter 11 of the most popular destinations.

title: "Honour First-Time Voters": PM Modi's Letter To Citizens On Constitution Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday urged citizens to fulfil their Constitutional duties, asserting that these were foundations for a strong democracy.

title: "Chennai Got 220,000 H-1B Visas": US Economist's "Fraud" Allegation
content: America's H-1B visa programme is once again in hot water after an economist accused the system of fraud, alleging that the Chennai district in India obtained more than twice the total number of visas allowed nationwide.

title: 17 Years Since 26/11: Remembering Horrors Of Mumbai Terror Attack
content: This year marks 17 years since terrorists from the Pakistan-backed Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) unleashed mayhem on the streets of India's financial capital, Mumbai, on November 26, 2008.

title: Trump Saves 2 Turkeys From Thanksgiving Table, Pardons 'Waddle' And 'Gobble'
content: Donald Trump turned Washington's fluffiest tradition into something a little tougher to carve on Tuesday -- swapping holiday cheer for political score-settling as he pardoned two turkeys in the annual White House Thanksgiving ceremony.

title: US Families 'Adopting' Turkeys Instead Of Eating Them On Thanksgiving
content: An increasing number of farm animal sanctuaries across the country have started promoting this alternative version of Thanksgiving in which families "adopt" turkeys and donate money to their lifelong care.

title: How Tulsi Gabbard's 'Hunters' Pounced On Secret CIA Warehouse For Kennedy Files
content: Donald Trump issued an order in January instructing Tulsi Gabbard to declassify records related to the Robert F Kennedy, John F Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr assassinations.

title: New Zealand Woman Who Stuffed Children's Bodies In Suitcases Jailed For Life
content: A woman in New Zealand who was convicted of murdering her two children and leaving their bodies in suitcases for years before they were discovered will spend at least 17 years in prison, a judge ruled Wednesday.

title: Jharkhand Man Lifts Wife, Slams Her on Ground. She Dies. Both Were Drunk
content: A 22-year-old woman was killed in Jharkhand's Palamu district after her husband allegedly lifted her and slammed her to the ground during a drunken brawl, police said.

title: Arunachal Woman's Unity Post, Message For Trolls After Shanghai Harassment
content: The woman from Arunachal Pradesh who faced harassment in China has hit out at trolls after the Shanghai airport episode.

content: Bengaluru-based tech firms contributed nearly all of the funding raised by tech companies across Karnataka

title: Former Indian diplomat Nirupama Rao reflects on music as the last form of diplomacy
content: Ahead of South Asian Symphony Orchestra‚Äôs performance at the Asian College of Journalism on November 30, former Indian Foreign Secretary Nirupama Rao and the founder of the South Asian Symphony Foundation writes about manoeuvring the world of wars, and treaties, and eventually finding respite in music

content: ‚ÄúThese properties must be immediately handed over to the Alirajpur district magistrate,‚Äù judge ordered under the Madhya Pradesh Special Courts Act 2011

content: Tamil Nadu and West Bengal are among the 12 States and Union Territories included in the second phase of the SIR exercise, announced on October 28

content: State Government is fully committed to supplying seven hours of uninterrupted three-phase power to farmers, says Minister

content: In his letter, the Prime Minister touched upon the importance of strengthening democracy by exercising the right to vote

title: 4.5 lakh illegal farm pumpsets identified in Karnataka for regularisation, says Minister
content: Proposal for the final decision on continuing the process will soon be placed before the State Cabinet, according to George

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Rival fronts fear public anger as pollution hogs the limelight
content: Public anger over industrial emissions and untreated wastewater is mounting pressure on political parties. While reverberations of agitations against a poultry waste treatment plant in Kozhikode is likely to shape voter sentiment, Ashtamudi Lake‚Äôs pollution is becoming a key poll issue in Kollam.

content: While some see eschewing voting as an act against the tenets of democracy, others say being apolitical is a choice

title: Nearly 14 lakh SIR forms identified as 'uncollectable' so far in West Bengal
content: These forms are "uncollectable" since the voters were either absentee, duplicate, dead or permanently shifted, an official said.

title: Shalibanda fire accident: Death toll rises to two as shop owner succumbs to burn injuries
content: Over 30 hours after the incident, the identity of the other deceased person is still unknown. Moghalpura police issued a lookout circular on Tuesday (November 25), but no one has come forward to claim the body so far.

title: TET paper leak racket busted in Kolhapur; 18 arrested
content: So far, we have arrested 18 persons in the case and the number may rise as the probe progresses. The involvement of more individuals, including facilitators and beneficiaries of the leak, is being investigated, the police said.

title: Widely quoted WHO norm of 1 doctor per 1,000 people is not official
content: The benchmark was repeatedly used by the government to compare doctor availability in India over the last decade

title: Mekedatu dam project: a long-standing source of friction between Tamil Nadu and Karnataka
content: The idea of the project proponent ‚Äì the Karnataka government ‚Äì is to impound 67.16 thousand million cubic ft (TMC) of water by building a balancing reservoir at Mekedatu (which, in Kannada, means ‚Äògoat‚Äôs leap‚Äô), about 100 km from Bengaluru.

title: Cabinet takes serious note of BRS charges on industrial land policy
content: BRS leaders indulging in mudslinging against govt. for political gains, relocation of industries within ORR limits not new, issue was mooted by previous governments also, say Ministers

title: Ootupurai, the traditional feeding house in Kanniyakumari temples
content: Ootupurai, where Brahmins were served free meals, was once a familiar institution across southern Travancore and Kanniyakumari district which remained part of Kerala until 1957. Although the British administration ordered the discontinuation of¬†this¬†system in 1922, it survived in several temples long after the decree.

title: Supreme Court issues notice on Vaiko‚Äôs plea against SIR in T.N.
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi listed the plea along with other petitions filed by political parties like DMK, CPI (Marxist), Congress and others against holding the SIR in the State

title: Advocates, civil society slam alleged intimidation of Muslim students at Kalyan college
content: Advocates and civil society condemn intrusion at Ideal College, call it a violation of constitutional¬†rights¬†and warn of Bombay High Court action if authorities¬†fail to¬†act

title: Konaseema Prabhala Teertham set to be declared as State festival of A.P.
content: The four-century-old festival is celebrated during Sankranthi, displaying a chariot procession taken out by 11 villages

title: Mamata will not get Matua votes, Suvendu claims after TMC rally
content: The BJP MLA also wrote to Chief Election Commissioner accusing State police officials of being affiliated to TMC and demanding the deployment of CAPF ‚Äúto ensure neutrality‚Äù in upcoming Assembly polls in 2026

title: Congress, NCP (SP) write to SEC over voter rolls, seeking transparency ahead of local body polls
content: Congress seeks 15-day extension for objections to draft voter lists as NCP (SP) flags coercion in local polls, a day after Uddhav and Raj Thackeray demanded¬†21 days

title: Raksha Khadse accuses Shinde-led Shiv Sena workers of intimidation in¬†Muktainagar
content: Raksha Khadse accused workers of Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena of intimidating residents in¬†Muktainagar, citing rising crime and harassment

title: Man acquitted in 26/11 case free to take up jobs that don‚Äôt need police clearance: Maharashtra Government
content: In September 2025, the Maharashtra government refused to issue a police clearance certificate to Fahim Ansari, acquitted in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks case, saying he¬†remains¬†under surveillance over suspected links to a banned terror outfit

title: Tribal teacher ushers in change, revives dilapidated school in ASR district
content: Palasa Naveen Kumar raises funds, involves community leaders to renovate the dilapidated building and guides 17 students to qualify Navodaya and Ekalavya entrance exams

title: Nigerian drug peddler arrested and 14.8 kg of synthetic drugs worth ‚Çπ23.7 crore recovered in Bengaluru
content: In one of the biggest drug busts in the city in recent times, the Anti Narcotics Wing of the Central Crime Branch on Tuesday arrested a 42-year-old Nigerian national and recovered 14.84 kg of synthetic drugs, including 11.6 kg of MDMA crystals, 1.04 kg of ecstasy pills, and 2.2 kg of raw chemicals used for preparation of the drugs, worth ‚Çπ23.7 crore

title: Census: Pilot project of house-listing begins in Bengaluru‚Äôs J.P. Park ward; centre officials review app testing
content: A pilot exercise to test a new mobile application developed for the 2027 Census is under way in J.P. Park ward under the North Corporation

title: Bihar government tells Rabri Devi to vacate official residence after two decades
content: Minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary confirmed the new allotment for Ms. Devi on Harding Road, saying, ‚ÄúIt has enough space and is designated for high-ranking officials‚Äù

title: India ‚Äòstrongly‚Äô took up with China detention of woman from Arunachal Pradesh at Shanghai airport: MEA
content: ‚ÄúArunachal Pradesh is an integral and inalienable part of India, and this is a self-evident fact; no amount of denial by the Chinese side is going to change this indisputable reality,‚Äù says Randhir Jaiswal

title: Odisha CM hands over 7,293 appointment letters
content: Against the target of providing 65,000 government jobs within two years, the Odisha government has appointed 37,325 persons in just 17 months, Mohan Majhi said

title: Ghati Subramanya temple to receive ‚Çπ29 crore for development works
content: The comprehensive development plan includes several major works aimed at improving facilities for devotees and enhancing the infrastructure around the popular temple

title: Former 26/11 prosecutor Ujjwal Nikam calls for ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô-like action against Pakistan terror modules
content: Former 26/11 prosecutor cites David Headley evidence, seeks military response over terror infrastructure

title: AIMSS expresses concern over increase in crime against women; launches month-long signature campaign
content: Citing statistics from the National Crime Records Bureau, the AIMSS says that between 2023 and 2025, there are 16,272 cases of sexual harassment registered in Karnataka, 5,456 dowry cases, 10,510 POCSO cases, 412 child marriages among others

title: SC‚Äôs judgment on TET: Stalin requests Modi to amend RTE Act, NCTE Act
content: The retrospective application of TET to certain groups has created a ‚Äúsignificant disruption of long-settled service rights, an administrative impossibility for the State, and poses a serious risk of destabilising the functioning of the school education system‚Äù, says CM

title: Chief Minister Stalin debunks claims of investments leaving¬†Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu is attracting investments amid intense competition from other States¬†and even countries such as Vietnam and Thailand, he says at the¬†TNRising¬†Conclave in¬†Coimbatore

title: Guru Tegh Bahadur stayed true to his faith until the end: PM
content: Personalities like Guru Tegh Bahadur ji are rare, and his life, sacrifice, and character remain a great source of inspiration, the PM said

title: Rajnath seeks global collaboration for boosting maritime capabilities
content: Defence Minister says India is ready to help shape the ‚Äúmaritime century‚Äù by ‚Äúbuilding not only ships, but trust; not only platforms, but partnerships‚Äù

title: Mata Vaishno Devi University ‚Äògets government grants every year‚Äô: NC
content: When public money is involved, every citizen of this Union Territory has an equal right to be there, irrespective of religion or background, NC leader Tanvir Sadiq said, rebutting the BJP‚Äôs stand

title: Defending Mamkootathil embarrasses Congress, says Youth Cong. leader
content: She says the MLA shall be expelled from the primary membership of the party and workers need to be saved from the humiliating situation of needing to respond to the sexual misbehaviour allegations against him

title: Over 22,000 NHM doctors, health workers in Assam face job insecurity: Congress
content: The party said Ayushman Bharat card services remain suspended in the State‚Äôs private hospitals for a long time, causing immense hardship to the poor

title: Residents alarmed as pollution turns Doddagubbi lake toxic; fish and birds found dead
content: According to locals, the lake has been steadily degrading over the past several months, with the water turning a murky green due to suspected sewage inflow from nearby residential buildings.

title: Former Tripura CM slams State government for arresting CPI(M) workers on ‚Äòflimsy grounds‚Äô
content: Manik Sarkar slammed the BJP and said that the use of ‚Äúunethical means and pressure tactics‚Äù to muzzle the voices of people would ‚Äúboomerang and isolate the oppressors‚Äù

title: Hyderabad heritage run to showcase city‚Äôs architectural legacy on February 1
content: The run is being positioned as a global platform to highlight Hyderabad‚Äôs heritage, says Tourism and Culture Minister Jupally Krishna Rao as he unveils the poster for the event

title: Army Chief pays homage to Operation Pawan bravehearts at National War Memorial
content: Hundreds of personnel were killed and over a thousand injured during Operation Pawan, the 1987 Indian Peace Keeping Force mission in Sri Lanka

title: Hyderabad zoo earns ISO tag for sixth time; Telangana launches tiger protection cell
content: New system will enable real-time monitoring of tiger reserves, says Minister; it will also enhance safety for people living near forest areas as alerts will be sent immediately if tiger movement is detected

title: BJD Rajya Sabha member Debasish Samantray quits party post
content: In a letter to former CM Naveen Patnaik, he says the party has failed to accept the cause of defeat in 2024 elections and take remedial measures

title: Kerala local body polls: Rebels set to spoil party for all three fronts
content: Hundreds of political leaders appear to have taken their cue from M.K. Varghese, a Congress rebel-turned-Independent, who became Mayor of the Thrissur Corporation with the support of the Left Democratic Front, and have thrown their hats into the ring against the official candidates of their own parties

title: Caste must not be allowed to divide us, whatever the circumstance: CJI Kant
content: The CJI said elections to Maharashtra local bodies could go ahead, subject to the outcome of proceedings

title: General Education minister V. Sivankutty objects to use of schoolchildren for Special Intensive Revision (SIR) work
content: CEO says only students of ELCs in schools and colleges and NSS volunteers who have time and are volunteering will be included

title: TGPCB shuts down 305 industries for violating pollution norms
content: Notices issued by Telangana Pollution Control Board to 1,234 units after 2,069 industries were reviewed; closure orders were later revoked for 697 industries upon confirmation of compliance

title: CISF personnel honoured for saving lives, vital installations during Operation Sindoor
content: CISF personnel ensured the safety of about 250 civilians, and the Uri-I and Uri-II hydroelectric projects in May 2025

title: Arman Tsarukyan reasserts his place near top at lightweight
content: arman Tsarukyan is one of the best lightweights in the world on saturday . he choked out Dan Hooker in a one-sided main event of UFC Fight Night in doha, Qatar . the only other movement in these rankings is at welterweight .

title: The wolves of Real Madrid are already snarling at Xabi Alonso's door
content: Xabi Alonso has defended his side following their 2-2 draw against Elche . the real madrid boss is in the top eight positions of the UEFA champions league . but he'll know he is. wolves are at the door and someone at his club is encouraging them to snarl .

title: Transfer portal primer: 'At 12:01 a.m. on Jan. 2, you're going to see people instantly commit'
content: the transfer portal officially opens on Jan. 2, the day after the college football playoff quarterfinals . the spring portal window in April means programs have one shot to get this right if they want to win big in 2026 . this season has brought more proof of concept that a portal-heavy approach can dramatically flip a program's fortunes, with Indiana and Texas Tech in the national championship hunt .

title: Jokic, SGA, Giannis and Luka are off to historic starts: Why this MVP race could be epic
content: Nikola Jokic has the best statistical start of his much-celebrated career in 2025-26 . he's averaging 29.6 points, 12.8 rebounds and 11.1 assists through 17 games this season . two other players in NB are eclipsing that mark .

title: Mitchell, Cunningham move up in latest NBA 2K26 ratings
content: 2K Games has announced its next round of changes to ratings for NBA 2K26 to reflect players' real-life ability on the court . Cade Cunningham from the Detroit Pistons is another player moving up by one point, to a 93 OVR . he scored 46 points with 12 rebounds, 11 assists, five steals and two blocks .

title: MLB offseason grades: Boston bolsters rotation with swap for Sonny Gray
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here . we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . a big-money free agent signing changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade .

title: Week 14 Anger Index: Why BYU, Notre Dame and others should be mad
content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

title: Sources: CSU expected to hire UConn's Mora
content: the deal is expected to come together in the near future, sources say . he will come to Colorado State as the school is joining the Pac-12 . it has churned through Mike Bobo, Steve Addazio and Jay Norvell .

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

title: Bills add help at receiver, sign veteran Cooks
content: the bills have elevated receiver Gabe Davis from the practice squad for the past two games . second-year receiver Keon Coleman has been a healthy scratch for the last two games stemming initially from disciplinary issues . quarterback dalton Kincaid has the most receiving touchdowns on the team wi-fi .

title: Free agent pickups: The players you need for a playoff push
content: the 12th Sunday of the season featured a historic outing by a Detroit Lions RB Jahmyr Gibbs and a notable comeback victories by the desperate Kansas City Chiefs and Dallas Cowboys . four teams served their bye this week, but none do this coming Thanksgiving week, which features a trio of games on Thursday .

title: Who's making the grade, and who's failing at the NHL quarter mark? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: SC backs sacking of lieutenant; calls refusal to go into gurdwara 'religious ego'
content: supreme court slams lieutenant for putting his own understanding of his faith over and above the religious sentiments of soldiers he was leading . lt Samuel Kamalesan had been commanding a troop of cavalrymen comprising Sikhs, Rajputs and Jats . the bench of CJI Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said one cannot claim breach of fundamental right to religion .

title: After seeking truce, Maoists call for ‚Äòfight till last breath‚Äô

title: Issues at border must not define bilateral ties: China envoy
content: Xu Feihong stressed that the "complex" border issue should not define bilateral ties and hinder cooperation . he also expressed hope that India and China would work together to defend multilateralism and reject "unilateral hegemony" he said that as two ancient civilisations have sufficient wisdom to maintain peace and tranquility in the border areas .

title: ‚ÄòSign of structural issues‚Äô: CJI Surya Kant addresses case backlog in courts
content: 5.4 crore cases are pending in trial courts, 63.8 lakh in high courts and 90,000 in SC . chief justice Surya Kant takes oath as the new CJI . he says the growing backlog of cases is a manifestation of deeper structural bottlenecks .
